postings.body:
Marriott timeshares offer the opportunity to have not only your vacation destination anywhere in the world, but also free for life! How? By buying units in advance, you can select the week(s) you want to travel, where you to go, and how much space you will need.
This Marriott Lake Shore Reserve 2 bedroom unit is a lock-off. This means you can have a 2 bedroom, 2 bath town home with full kitchen for a week every other year. OR, you can have a 1 bedroom town home with full kitchen every year!
Based in beautiful Orlando, Fl. this luxury resort is 10 minutes from Disney, Universal, Sea World and all that Orlando has to offer.
This unit, if purchased through Marriott is $18,000. Since I was an original owner when this property was built in 2010, you can have it for $10,000! That`s almost 1/2 off the original, and currently offered pricing from Marriott. AND, once paid off, you can gift the unit to your family.
If you were to pay for 7 nights in a resort like this, it would likely be $250/night. 7 nights @ $250 = $1750. Keep this timeshare for 6 years, and for the rest of you life, you stay for free!
To see more photos, go to - http://www.marriott.com/hotels/hotel-photos/mcolr-marriotts-lakeshore-reserve/.
Platinum season means you get premium trade value if you decide to stay somewhere else - anywhere else in the world. I stayed in a very nice villa outside of Paris, France last June.

location.formatted_address: Jersey Shore Calvary Chapel, 808 Laura Herbert Drive, Point Pleasant, NJ 08742, USA

postings.heading: SINGLE MALE LOOKING TO RENT A ROOM

postings.body:
Updated 7/26
Hi there. I`m Dave.
I`m looking for looking for a second responsible, gay/gay-friendly roommate to share my house in Aurora. Please note that I`m in Aurora - a far western suburb - and not Chicago, itself. My house is a 40-60 minute drive from downtown.
The place is a decent-sized two-story, gutted & modernized. Upstairs: 3 bedrooms (one of which is a guest room), full bath, a small loft area. Main Floor: living room, dining room, eat-in kitchen, a 4th bedroom/den. I have included the house`s floorplan in my photos. The full basement is clean & dry, with a laundry room, a 2nd bathroom/shower, a playroom. New wiring/plumbing/smokes throughout. Central AC. Great covered/wraparound porch in the front. No garage, but the single car driveway fits 2 vehicles back to back, if needed. Nice old neighborhood. Plenty of street parking.
I`m renting the downstairs 4th bedroom (which I`ve used before as a den). It`s decent sized, with 2 large windows & a high ceiling, and a generous closet. Clean, repainted. Close to the kitchen/living room, so not quite as private as upstairs. Please note it`s location on the floorplan.
There is one other renter renter in the house (31, male, gay, in a 2nd upstairs bedroom), so there will be a total of three of us. The atmosphere is fun, mature, and a little unconventional. For a renter, you should be responsible, timely with rent, and cool with my/our social life. Friends, overnight guests are, but please keep the common areas clean...and let`s all respect each others` stuff & privacy. We try to keep a sober, drama-free environment.
As for me...I`m 45, gay, I`m a member of Recon and I attend IML. I work in retail management, I like to cook, clean, garden, draw, and work on home improvement projects. I published my first novel last year, and I`m currently working on my next one. I also have a very dry/twisted sense of humor, and I get along best with the same.
I don`t expect a new best friend, but I do want to be comfortable enough with you to watch TV or have an occasional pizza together. $475/monthly gets you the mentioned bedroom, all utilities, basic cable, WiFi, access to washer/dryer, full use of the house.
Btw, I have a cat. She`s 6 years old, friendly, and afraid of dogs.
If you respond to this ad, please take a moment and tell me a little about yourself - nothing too personal; just enough so I know you`re not a scam - and that you`d fit the "mix" of the house. I try to respond to all serious inquiries, but "serious" means more than a few short sentences...and politeness is always appreciated.
Available now.
Thanks
